intro: Rhynchospora stuebelii, commonly known as Stuebel's beakgrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Rhynchospora stuebelii is often found in association with other wetland flora, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
